meanings.sent1: She deprecated his choice of music.
meanings.sent2: The teacher deprecated the use of outdated sources in the research paper.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly deprecated her taste in movies.
meanings.sent4: The coach deprecated the team's effort by calling it lackluster.
meanings.sent5: Her disapproving look deprecated his behavior instantly.

meanings.definition: To belittle or express disapproval of
meanings.sent1: He deprecated her achievements in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: The critic deprecated the actor's performance in the play.
meanings.sent3: She playfully deprecated his cooking skills.
meanings.sent4: His constant criticism deprecated her self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The boss's harsh words deprecated his hard work.

meanings.definition: To make something seem less important or less effective
meanings.sent1: The new policy deprecated the old procedures.
meanings.sent2: His actions deprecated the value of the antique vase.
meanings.sent3: The comedian deprecated the seriousness of the situation with a joke.
meanings.sent4: Her bright smile deprecated the gloomy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The colorful decorations deprecated the plain walls of the room.
